column4: oh dear...i'm about to run an XP virtual machine because i cannot seem to RDP into my work computer any other way...anyone have a way that will work to RDP from ubuntu to windoze 7?
terminal server client won't connect
just tells me connection reset by peer
its prob the firewall on the Winblows 7 pc blocking it
nah, i can connect from other windows machines
what version OS you running (linux)
are you trying to connect via IP or DNS?
tried both ways
everything else network related works on Ubuntu?
yes, in fact i can even mount a share on that doze7 computer...
did you select RDP or RDPv5?
i think it has something to do with the fact that it's a computer on my work's domain.  tried both RDP versions
are you trying to RDP via a VPN connection or anything?
the win7 machine is connected to openvpn, but it's on my local network.  im trying to connect via my subnet
meaning the machine is physically here, has a local IP, but also is on work's domain
err VPN
run nmap -v <ip of windows pc>
think i have it
one sec
Get it working?
laptop was set to require network level authentication.  when i turned that off it worked perfectly.  facepalm @ me
thanks for the help though :)
good deal, np
